metadata.source: unknown source; cf. the edition by P. Pradhan. Vasubandhu, Abhidharmakośabhāṣya, rev. 2nd ed. with introduction and indices by A. Haldar, Patna 1975 (Tibetan Sanskrit Works Series, 8), and G.V. Gokhale, The Text of the Abhidharmakośakārikā of Vasubandhu, Journal of the Bombay Branch of the Royal Asiatic Society, New Series, vol. 22 (1946), pp. 73-102.

children.translated_text: He who has completely destroyed all darkness and lifted the world from the mire of <s>saṃsāra</s> (worldly existence),

children.text: tasmai namaskṛtya yathārthaśāstre śāstraṃ pravakṣyāmyabhidharmakośam // VAkK_1.1 //
children.translated_text: To him, having paid homage, I shall expound the treatise, the <s>Abhidharmakośa</s>, according to the true scripture

children.text: prajñāmalā sānucarābhidharmaḥ tatprāptaye yāpi ca yacca śāstram /
children.translated_text: The pure wisdom is accompanied by <s>Abhidharma</s>, for the attainment of which, and the scripture which is also,

children.text: tasyārthato 'smin samanupraveśāt sa cā śrayo 'syetyabhidharmakośam // VAkK_1.2 //
children.translated_text: Through the entry into its meaning, this is its basis, thus is the <s>Abhidharmakośa</s>

children.text: dharmāṇāṃ pravicayamantareṇa nāsti kleśānāṃ yata upaśāntaye 'bhyupāyaḥ /
children.translated_text: Without the discernment of <s>Dharmas</s>, there is no means for the pacification of afflictions,

children.text: kleśaiśca bhramati bhavārṇave 'tra lokastaddhetorata uditaḥ kilaiṣa śāstrā // VAkK_1.3 //
children.translated_text: And due to afflictions, the world wanders in the ocean of existence; for that reason, this scripture is declared
The <s>Dharmas</s> with outflows and without outflows are conditioned, devoid of the path
Those with outflows are called outflows because they adhere to them
The without outflows is the truth of the path, and also the unconditioned is threefold

children.text: ākāśaṃ dvau nirodhau ca tatrākāśamanāvṛtiḥ // VAkK_1.5 //
children.translated_text: Space and two cessations are there, among them, space is unobstructed
The cessation through knowledge is disjunction, separately,
The other cessation is the absolute hindrance to arising, through non-knowledge
These again are conditioned <s>Dharmas</s>, the five aggregates beginning with form

children.text: sa evādhvā kathāvastu saniḥsārāḥ savastukāḥ // VAkK_1.7 //
children.translated_text: That very path is the subject of discourse, having essence and having substance
Those with outflows are the aggregates of clinging, they are also suffering

children.text: duḥkhaṃ samudayo loko dṛṣṭisthānaṃ bhavaśca te // VAkK_1.8 //
children.translated_text: They are suffering, origination, world, viewpoint, and existence
Form, the five senses, the objects, and also the non-manifest
The bases of their consciousness, the purity of form are the eye and others
Form is twofold, twentyfold; sound is eightfold, taste
Is sixfold, smell is fourfold; touch is of eleven kinds
Even for one with a distracted mind, the connection which is auspicious or inauspicious,
Is called non-manifest, taking the great elements as its basis
The elements are earth, water, fire, and air
Perfected by actions such as holding, roughness, moisture, heat, and motion
Earth is called by the designation of the world as color arrangement

children.text: āpastejaśca vāyustu dhātureva tathāpi ca // VAkK_1.13 //
children.translated_text: Water, fire, and air are also called elements
The objects of the senses are desired, the ten bases and elements
Feeling, perception, and grasping of signs are their nature
From the four, the other is the aggregate of formations; again, these three
Are known as the base and element of <s>Dharmas</s>, along with the non-manifest and unconditioned

children.text: vijñānaṃ prativijñaptiḥ mana āyatanaṃ ca tat /
children.translated_text: Consciousness, counter-consciousness, and the base of mind is that

children.text: dhātavaḥ sapta ca matāḥ ṣaḍ vijñānānyatho mahaḥ // VAkK_1.16 //
children.translated_text: Seven elements are considered, and six consciousnesses, then the great
The consciousness that is immediately past of the six, indeed that is mind
For the purpose of the famous sixth base, eighteen elements are remembered
The complete collection by one aggregate and base,
And by the element, by nature, due to separation from other states
The commonality of birth, range, and consciousness is the singular element

children.text: dvitve 'pi cakṣurādīnāṃ śobhārtha tu dvayodbhavaḥ // VAkK_1.19 //
children.translated_text: Even in duality, of the eye and others, for the purpose of beauty, the arising of two
The meanings of heap, door, and lineage are aggregates, bases, and elements
The threefold explanation of aggregates, etc., is the delusion, sense organ, and form
Due to being the cause of <s>saṃsāra</s> and the root of dispute, from the reason of sequence
From the mental factors, feeling and perception are separately established as aggregates
In aggregates, the conditioned is not said due to the unfitness of meaning; again the sequence
As from the gross defilement, receptacle, etc., the element of meaning
Before, the five from the meaning of the present, and the four from the meaning of the physical
The sequence is in accordance with the distant and near functions, or otherwise
For the purpose of specificity, from the collection of primary <s>Dharmas</s>,
One base is called form, one is called <s>Dharma</s>
The sage declared eighty thousand aggregates of <s>Dharmas</s>
Their collection is known as form and formations by name
śāstrapramāṇā ityeke skandhādīnāṃ kathaikaśaḥ /
The counteraction of conduct is described as the aggregate of <s>Dharma</s>
Thus, others also, according to their connection, aggregates, bases, and elements,
are to be explained as stated, considering their individual characteristics.
The gap called the element of <s>Ākāśa</s> (space) is indeed light and darkness,
the element of consciousness is consciousness, associated with afflictions and dependent on birth.
Here, with perception, there is one form, and ten with resistance,

children.text: rūpiṇaḥ avyākṛtā aṣṭau ta evārūpaśabdakāḥ // VAkK_1.29 //
children.translated_text: those with form are eight, unmanifested; those same are without form and named sound.
In three ways, those obtained in the realm of desire, all in form are fourteen,
except for the elements of smell, taste, nose, tongue consciousness.
Those obtained in the formless realm are the elements of mental objects and mind consciousness,

children.text: sāsravānāsravā ete trayaḥ śeṣāstu sāsravāḥ // VAkK_1.31 //
children.translated_text: these three are with and without afflictions; the rest are with afflictions.
With initial and sustained thought are indeed five elements of consciousness,
the last three are of three kinds; the rest are devoid of both.
By examination, recollection, and analysis, they are without conceptualization,

children.text: tau prajñāmānasī vyagrā smṛtiḥ sarvaiva mānasī // VAkK_1.33 //
children.translated_text: those two, wisdom and mind, are active; all memory is mental.
Seven elements of mind with support, and half by the nature of <s>Dharma</s>,

children.text: navānupāttā te cāṣṭau śabdaśca anye nava dvidhā // VAkK_1.34 //
children.translated_text: nine are not obtained; those eight and sound are the other nine in two ways.

children.text: spraṣṭavyaṃ dvividhaṃ śeṣā rūpiṇo nava bhautikāḥ /
children.translated_text: The tangible is of two kinds; the rest are nine material elements,
and a part of the <s>Dharma</s> element is accumulated, ten with form.

children.text: chinatti chidyate caiva bāhyaṃ dhātu catuṣṭayam /
children.translated_text: It cuts and is cut, indeed, the external element in four ways,
it burns and balances thus, the dispute between the burner and the burned.
The ripened and accumulated are five, internal, the ripened,

children.text: na śabdaḥ apratighā aṣṭau naiḥṣyandika vipākajāḥ // VAkK_1.37 //
children.translated_text: not sound, without resistance, eight are non-obstructive ripened.
In three ways, one is substantial; the last three are momentary,

children.text: cakṣurvijñānadhātvoḥ syāt pṛthak lābhaḥ sahāpi ca // VAkK_1.38 //
children.translated_text: of the eye and consciousness elements, there is a separate gain, also together.
The twelve internal, excluding form and others, are known as <s>Dharma</s>,

children.text: sabhāgaḥ tatsabhāgāśca śeṣāḥ yo na svakarmakṛt // VAkK_1.39 //
children.translated_text: similar, and those similar are the rest, which are not their own actions.

children.text: daśa bhāvanayā heyāḥ pañca ca antyāstrayastridhā /
children.translated_text: Ten are to be abandoned by cultivation, and five, the last three in three ways,

children.text: na dṛṣṭiheyamakliṣṭaṃ na rūpaṃ nāpyaṣaṣṭhajam // VAkK_1.40 //
children.translated_text: not abandoned by view, untainted, not form, nor the sixty-fourth.
The eye and the <s>Dharma</s> element, the regions, view in eight ways,
the five consciousnesses are innate, not view due to non-transcendence.

children.text: cakṣuḥ paśyati rūpāṇi sabhāgaṃ na tadāśritam /
children.translated_text: The eye sees forms, similar, not dependent on that,

children.text: vijñānaṃ dṛśyate rūpaṃ na kilāntaritaṃ yataḥ // VAkK_1.42 //
children.translated_text: consciousness perceives form, not indeed separated from it.
Also by both eyes, it sees due to clear vision,
the eye, ear, and mind, the object not attained, the three otherwise.
By the three, nose, etc., it is considered similar object grasping,
the last is the support, past, of the five, and innate with them.
Due to transformation and being transformed, the supports are the eye, etc.,
thus, due to non-commonality, consciousness is defined by them.

children.text: na kāyasyādharaṃ cakṣuḥ ūrdhvaṃ rūpaṃ na cakṣuṣaḥ /
children.translated_text: The eye is not the support of the body; the form is not above the eye,

children.text: vijñānaṃ ca asya rūpaṃ tu kāyasyobhe ca sarvataḥ // VAkK_1.46 //
children.translated_text: and consciousness, indeed, is the form of this, and both of the body everywhere.

children.text: tathā śrotraṃ trayāṇāṃ tu sarvameva svabhūmikam /
children.translated_text: Thus, the ear of the three is indeed entirely its own realm,
the body consciousness is the lower realm, and the mind is indefinite.

children.text: pañca bāhyā divijñeyāḥ nityā dharmā asaṃskṛtāḥ /
children.translated_text: Five external, known as divine, are eternal <s>Dharmas</s>, unconditioned,

children.text: dharmārdhamindriyaṃ ye ca dvādaśādhyātmikāḥ smṛtāḥ // VAkK_1.48 //
children.translated_text: and those known as the twelve internal, half are sense organs.

body.text: abhidharmakośabhāṣye dhātunirdeśo nāma prathamaṃ kośasthānaṃ samāptamiti /
body.translated_text: In the <s>Abhidharma</s> Commentary, the section named 'Description of Elements', the first section of the treasury is thus completed.

children.text: ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetusteṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
children.translated_text: The <s>Tathāgata</s> has indeed said the causes of those <s>Dharmas</s> that arise from causes,

children.text: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
children.translated_text: and their cessation; thus spoke the Great Ascetic.

body.translated_text: The second section of the treasury

children.translated_text: In four purposes, the mastery of five is indeed of two,
of four and five aggregates, in defilement and purification.
From the mastery of self-realization, and of all the six senses,
by the mastery of femaleness and maleness, from the body to the female and male senses.
By the mastery of the establishment of groups, defilement, and purification,

children.text: jīvitaṃ vedanāḥ pañca śraddhādyāścendriyaṃ matāḥ // VAkK_2.3 //
children.translated_text: life, feelings, the five, and faith, etc., are considered the senses.
The faculty known as <s>Ājñā</s> (command), also called <s>Ājñākhyam</s>, is the faculty of understanding,
attained progressively through mastery leading to <s>Nirvāṇa</s> and other achievements.
The support of the mind, its variety, its stability and disturbance,

children.text: saṃbhāro vyavadānaṃ ca yāvatā tāvadindriyam // VAkK_2.5 //
children.translated_text: the accumulation and purification, all these constitute the faculties.
From the basis of activity, arising, stability, and counter-enjoyment,
thus are fourteen other faculties, or faculties of cessation.
The faculty of pain is that which is unpleasurable, the bodily sensation of happiness,

children.text: śātā dhyāne tṛtīye tu caitasī sā sukhendriyam // VAkK_2.7 //
children.translated_text: in the third meditation, it is mental and is the faculty of pleasure.

children.text: anyatra sā saumanasyaṃ aśātā caitasī punaḥ /
children.translated_text: Elsewhere it is joy, and again the unpleasurable mental state,

children.text: daurmanasyamupekṣā tu madhyā ubhayī avikalpanāt // VAkK_2.8 //
children.translated_text: grief and indifference are both middle, without discrimination.
In the path of vision and non-learning, nine, three, the pure three,

children.text: rūpīṇi jīvitaṃ duḥkhe sāsravāṇi dvidhā nava // VAkK_2.9 //
children.translated_text: the form, life, in suffering, the defiled, twice nine.
The result, life, in two ways, twelve, except the last eight,

children.text: daurmanasyācca tattvekaṃ savipākaṃ daśa dvidhā // VAkK_2.10 //
children.translated_text: and also grief, that one, with result, ten in two ways.
Mind, other cognition, faith, and others, the eightfold, the skillful in two ways,

children.text: daurmanasyaṃ mano 'nyā ca vittistredhā anyadekadhā // VAkK_2.11 //
children.translated_text: grief, mind, and other cognition in three ways, other in one way.
Having abandoned the desire-attained, the pure, attained form in the faculties of woman and man,

children.text: duḥkhe ca hitvā ārūpyāptaṃ sukhe cāpohya rūpi ca // VAkK_2.12 //
children.translated_text: and having abandoned in suffering, attained formless, and in happiness, removing form as well.
The triad of mind and cognition in three ways, two to be abandoned, grief,

children.text: nava bhavanayā pañca tvaheyānyapi na trayam // VAkK_2.13 //
children.translated_text: nine by becoming, five to be abandoned, also not the three.
In desires initially, two results are obtained, not by those born of cause,

children.text: teḥ ṣaḍ vā sapta vā aṣṭau vā ṣaḍ rūpeṣu ekamuttare // VAkK_2.14 //
children.translated_text: six, or seven, or eight, or six in forms, one beyond.
It ceases, from cessation, in formlessness, life, mind,

children.text: upekṣāṃ caiva rūpe 'ṣṭau kāme daśa navāṣṭau vā // VAkK_2.15 //
children.translated_text: and indifference, indeed, in form, eight, in desire, ten, or nine, or eight.

children.text: kramamṛtyau tu catvāri śubhe sarvatra pañca ca /
children.translated_text: In order and death, four, in the auspicious everywhere, and five,
nine attainments in the final fruits, seven, eight, nine, for both.
With eleven, <s>Arhat</s>-hood is said, due to the occurrence of one,
associated with indifference, life, and mind, necessarily with three.
With four, with the body of pleasure, with five, possessing the eye and others,

children.text: saumanasyī ca duḥkhī tu saptabhiḥ strīndriyādimān // VAkK_2.18 //
children.translated_text: and with joy, but with seven, possessing the faculties of woman and others,
with eight, with eleven, indeed, associated with the faculties of command and knowing,
endowed with the faculties of command, associated with thirteen.
With all few, pure, with eight, without mind, body, life,
equipped, child, thus in formlessness, with indifference, life, mind, auspicious.
Endowed with many, with nineteen, devoid of impurities,
with two genders, noble, attached, with one gender, devoid of dual impurities.
In desire, eight-material, soundless, atomic, without faculties,
with body faculties, nine-material, ten-material, without faculties.
The mind, and mental factors, necessarily together, with all conditioned characteristics,

children.text: prāptyā vā pañcadhā caittā mahābhūmyādibhedataḥ // VAkK_2.23 //
children.translated_text: or with attainment, in five ways, mental factors, differing by great ground, and others.

children.text: vedanā cetanā saṃjñā cchandaḥ sparśo matiḥ smṛtiḥ /
children.translated_text: Sensation, volition, perception, intention, contact, intelligence, memory,
attention, determination, and concentration in all mental states.
Faith, diligence, tranquility, indifference, modesty, absence of shame,

children.text: mūladvayamahiṃsā ca vīryaṃ ca kuśale sadā // VAkK_2.25 //
children.translated_text: the two roots, non-violence, and energy, always in the skillful.
Delusion, negligence, laziness, lack of faith, sloth, agitation,
in the afflicted, always unskillful, shamelessness, absence of modesty.
Anger, resentment, deceit, envy, stinginess, safeguarding, jealousy,
illusion, pride, and violence, minor afflictive grounds.
Due to initial and sustained thought, in the skillful, in the mind of desire,
twenty-two mental factors, sometimes with remorse as additional.
In the specific, unskillful, with views, also twenty,
with four afflictions, beginning with anger, twenty-one with remorse.
In cessation, eighteen, elsewhere twelve, considered undetermined,

children.text: middhaṃ sarvāvirodhitvādyatra syādadhikaṃ hi tat // VAkK_2.30 //
children.translated_text: where dullness is, without opposition, there it is indeed additional.
Remorse, dullness, unskillful, in the first meditation, therefore are not,
in the subsequent meditation, initial and sustained thought are also beyond.
Lack of shame, heaviness in the blameworthy, fear, and showing of respect,

children.text: prema śraddhā gurutvaṃ hrīḥ te punaḥ kāmarūpayoḥ // VAkK_2.33 //
children.translated_text: affection, faith, respect, these again are the forms of <s>Hrīḥ</s> (modesty) in lustful forms
Movement in speculative thought, generosity, subtlety, pride, elevation,

children.text: madaḥ svadharme raktasya paryādānaṃ tu cetasaḥ // VAkK_2.33 //
children.translated_text: arrogance in one's own duty, attachment, and withdrawal of the mind
Mind, intellect, and consciousness are of one meaning with mental factors,
having support, object forms, and are conjoined in five ways
But the <s>saṃskāras</s> (mental formations) are unassociated, attainment and non-attainment, similarity,

children.text: āsaṃjñikaṃ samāpattī jīvitaṃ lakṣaṇāni ca // VAkK_2.35 //
children.translated_text: non-perception, attainment, life, and characteristics
Names, bodies, etc., thus attainment, gain, and conjunction
Attainment and non-attainment of one's own continuum, and cessation of the fallen ones
Of the three times, threefold, of the auspicious, starting with auspiciousness,
innate, of those who have attained it, and those who have not, fourfold
Threefold for those not to be abandoned, of the learners and non-learners, twofold is considered
Unspecified attainment is innate, except for the <s>Abhijñā</s> (higher knowledge) and <s>Nairmāṇika</s> (illusory body)

children.text: nivṛtasya ca rūpasya kāme rūpasya nāgrajā /
children.translated_text: And of the form of cessation, in desire, of form, not prior-born,
Untroubled, unspecified attainment, of past and future births, threefold
Of those attained from desire, and the pure, the non-attainment of the path is desired
Common personhood is removed by attainment and movement of the base
Similarity of disposition, non-perception among the non-perceivers,
Cessation of mind and mental factors, their fruition is of great result
Thus non-perceptive attainment, in the last meditation, by desire for release
Auspicious, cognizable only by the noble one, one course is obtained
This named cessation, thus, for the purpose of abode, produced by existence,

children.text: śubhā dvivedyāniyatā ca āryasya āpyā prayogataḥ // VAkK_2.43 //
children.translated_text: Auspicious, twofold cognizable, and indeterminate for the noble one, attainable by practice
Attainable enlightenment of the sage, not before the attainment of thirty-four moments
Based on the forms of desire, in beings, named cessation, not among men
Life and lifespan as support, indeed of warmth and consciousness,
Characteristics, rebirth, old age, stability, impermanence
Of their kinds and types, these have the single function of eightfold dharma
The birth of the born is not without cause and conditions
Names, bodies, etc., designations, expressions, syllables,
Known for attained forms of desire, and the outflows are also unspecified

children.text: sabhāgatā sā tu punarvipāko 'pi āptayo dvidhā /
children.translated_text: Similarity, and again fruition, and attainments are twofold

children.text: lakṣaṇāni ca niḥṣyandāḥ samāpattya samanvayāḥ // VAkK_2.48 //
children.translated_text: Characteristics and outflows, attainment, and conjunction
Cause, coexistence, similarity, conjunction,
The all-pervasive, known as fruition, is considered a sixfold cause
From oneself and others, cause, condition, coexistence, mutual results
Like elements, the characteristics of mind and mental factors, as the observed

children.text: caittā dvau saṃvarau teṣāṃ cetaso lakṣaṇāni ca /
children.translated_text: Two mental factors, restraints, and their mental characteristics
Following the mind, with time, results, and auspiciousness, etc.
The similar cause, of one's own kind, the elder
Mutually, the nine grounds, the path, equally distinguished
Born of practice, indeed, of hearing, reflection, and the like
The conjunctional cause is the mind and mental factors, with the same support
Known as the all-pervasive, of the afflicted, in their own ground, previously all-pervasive
The fruition cause, unwholesome and wholesome, indeed with afflictions
The all-pervasive and similar, twofold path, threefold of the three times

children.text: saṃskṛtaṃ savisaṃyoga phalaṃ nāsaṃskṛtasya te // VAkK_2.55 //
children.translated_text: Conditioned, with separation, the result, not of the unconditioned
The fruition result of the last, the previous one, the dominant result
The outflow of the similar and all-pervasive, the personal of the two
Fruition, unspecified, the dharma known as disposition, arising from the specified

children.text: niḥṣyando hetusadṛśaḥ visaṃyogaḥ kṣayo dhiyā // VAkK_2.57 //
children.translated_text: The outflow similar to cause, separation, destruction by wisdom
By whose force that is born, that result is produced by effort
Unprecedented, indeed of the conditioned, the conditioned result of the dominant

children.text: varttamānāḥ phalaṃ pañca gṛṇhanti dvau prayacchataḥ /
children.translated_text: The present ones take five results, giving two
The present and past two, one past gives
Afflictions, resultant, and the remaining ones, the first noble ones in sequence

children.text: vipākaṃ sarvagaṃ hitvā tau sabhāgaṃ ca śeṣajāḥ // VAkK_2.60 //
children.translated_text: Abandoning the universal result, those two and the remaining ones are of the same kind
Mind and mental factors, thus also others, devoid of conjunction

children.text: catvāraḥ pratyayā uktāḥ hetvākhyaḥ pañca hetavaḥ // VAkK_2.61 //
children.translated_text: Four causes are stated, called causes, five causes
Mind and mental factors, non-moving, arising immediately after
Object, all phenomena, called cause, is remembered as the chief

children.text: nirudhyamāne kāritraṃ dvau hetū kurutaḥ trayaḥ /
children.translated_text: When being obstructed, two conditions create three

children.text: jāyamāne tato 'nyau tu pratyayau tadviparyayāt // VAkK_2.63 //
children.translated_text: When arising, then the other two conditions, by reversal of that
By four, mind and mental factors indeed, two attainments by three

children.text: dvābhyāmanye tu jāyante neśvarādeḥ kramādibhiḥ // VAkK_2.64 //
children.translated_text: By two, others indeed arise, not by the sequence of <s>Īśvara</s>

children.text: dvidhā bhūtāni taddhetuḥ bhautikasya tu pañcadhā /
children.translated_text: Twice divided, beings, the cause of that, of the material, but fivefold
Thrice the material, mutually, of beings, indeed that is singular
Wholesome and unwholesome in desire, restrained and unrestrained mind
In form and formless, apart from unwholesome, the stainless is twofold

children.text: kāme nava śubhāccittāccittāni aṣṭābhya eva tat /
children.translated_text: In desire, nine from the auspicious mind, indeed from eight, that
From ten, unwholesome, from that four restrained likewise
From five, unrestrained, from that seven minds subsequently

children.text: rūpe daśaikaṃ ca śubhāt navabhyastadanantaram // VAkK_2.68 //
children.translated_text: In form, ten and one from the auspicious, from nine subsequently

children.text: aṣṭābhyo nivṛtaṃ tasmāt ṣaṭ tribhyo 'nivṛtaṃ punaḥ /
children.translated_text: From eight, restrained, from that six, from three unrestrained again

children.text: tasmāt ṣaṭ evāmārūpye tasya nītiḥ śubhātpunaḥ // VAkK_2.69 //
children.translated_text: From that, six indeed in formless, of that rule, from auspicious again

children.text: nava cittāni tat ṣaṇṇāṃ nivṛtātsapta tattathā /
children.translated_text: Nine minds from that of six, from restrained seven, thus also

children.text: caturbhyaḥ śaikṣam asmāttu pañca aśaikṣaṃ tu pañcakāt // VAkK_2.70 //
children.translated_text: From four, the trainee, from that, five non-trainee, indeed from five
From that, four minds, twelve these, twenty

children.text: prāyogikopapattyāptaṃ śubhaṃ bhittvā triṣu dvidhā // VAkK_2.71 //
children.translated_text: Acquired through practice and rebirth, auspicious, breaking in three, twofold
By resultant, path-bound, skill-based, local and divine
Fourfold, indeterminate in desire, in form devoid of skill

children.text: kliṣṭe traidhātuke lābhaḥ ṣaṇṇāṃ ṣaṇṇāṃ dvayoḥ śubhe /
children.translated_text: In afflicted threefold world, gain of six, six, in two auspicious

children.text: trayāṇāṃ rūpaje śaikṣe caturṇāṃ tasya śeṣite // VAkK_2.73 //
children.translated_text: Of three in form-born, in trainee, four of that remaining

children.translated_text: Hell-beings, pretas, animals, humans, and six gods
The realm of desire, thus with the division of hell regions, twenty
Above, seventeen places, the realm of form, each separately

children.text: dhyānaṃ tribhūmikaṃ tatra caturthaṃ tvaṣṭabhūmikam // VAkK_3.2 //
children.translated_text: Meditation in three levels, there the fourth in eight levels
The formless realm's place, by rebirth, fourfold

children.text: nikāyaṃ jīvitaṃ cātra niśritā cittasantatiḥ // VAkK_3.3 //
children.translated_text: The group and life here, the continuum of consciousness
The destinations beginning with hell, named as such, five among them
Unafflicted, indeterminate indeed, known as beings, not the intermediate state
Various body perceptions and those with one perception of various bodies
And by reversal, those with one body perception, the formless abode
The consciousness states, seven, the remainder with subdivisions
The beings with the perception of the summit of existence, nine abodes of beings are remembered
Due to the absence of desire, others, four states again

children.text: catvāraḥ sāsravāḥ skandhāḥ svabhūmāveva kevalam // VAkK_3.7 //
children.translated_text: Four with defilements, aggregates in their respective realms only

children.text: vijñānaṃ na sthitiḥ proktaṃ catuṣkoṭi tu saṃgrahe /
children.translated_text: Consciousness is not a state, it is said, fourfold in the summary
Four origins there, of beings, egg-born and others
Fourfold, humans, animals, hell-beings, spontaneously born
Intermediate state gods and also pretas, womb-born
Between death and rebirth, the intermediate existence here
Not having reached the destination, the intermediate existence is not attained
Due to the similarity with the continuity of rice, uninterrupted arising of existence
Due to the unreality of the reflection and dissimilarity, it is not seen
Due to the absence of both together, from the lack of continuity, from the arising of both
Because of the saying of Kaṇṭha, from the Gandharva, from the fivefold statement, according to the path
By the single impulse, he will attain, the previous time's form of existence
He indeed, beyond the moment of rebirth prior to death,
having the vision of pure and divine eyes of the same kind, possessing the force of perfected action,

children.text: sakalākṣaḥ apratighavān anivartyaḥ sa gandhabhuk // VAkK_3.14 //
children.translated_text: having all senses, without obstruction, unreturning, he is a consumer of fragrance.
With a deluded mind, he goes to the destined place with desire,
another, desiring the place of fragrance, having feet upwards, is of hell.
One enters with full awareness; another indeed remains, yet another,
leaves all, another is deluded, eternally born from an egg.
Three enter the womb, of <s>Cakravartin</s> and <s>Swayambhu</s>,
or of both, due to the clarity of action and knowledge, in sequence.
There is no self, only the aggregates, indeed, conditioned by afflictions and actions,
with the continuity of intermediate existence, like a lamp, it enters the womb.
As per the projection, the continuum grows in order, by afflictions and actions,
again goes to the other world, thus the beginningless cycle of existence.
That is dependent origination, with twelve links in three sections,
two at the beginning and end, and eight fully in the middle.
The former afflictions, ten ignorances, are formations of previous actions,
the junction aggregates are consciousness, name, and form thereafter.
Before the arising of the six sense bases, prior to that, from the union of three,
contact, prior to pleasure and pain, from the power of causal knowledge.
Perception, prior to intercourse, thirst for enjoyment, attachment to sexual union,

children.text: upādānaṃ tu bhogānāṃ prāptaye paridhāvataḥ // VAkK_3.23 //
children.translated_text: appropriation indeed, for the attainment of enjoyments, running around.

children.text: sa bhaviṣyat bhavaphalaṃ kurute karma tat bhavaḥ /
children.translated_text: He will produce the fruit of becoming through action, that is existence,
re-linking, rebirth again, old age, and death indeed.
This, indeed, is desired as situational, due to prominence, the mention of limbs,
in the middle of the beginning and end, for the removal of delusion.

children.text: kleśāstrīṇi dvayaṃ karma sapta vastu phalaṃ tathā /
children.translated_text: Three afflictions, two actions, seven entities, and also the fruit,
contraction of cause and effect, in the middle of two, by inference.

children.text: kleśāt kleśaḥ kriyā caiva tato vastu tataḥ punaḥ /
children.translated_text: From affliction, affliction and action indeed, then entity, then again,

children.text: vastu kleśāśca jāyante bhavāṅgānāmayaṃ nayaḥ // VAkK_3.27 //
children.translated_text: entities and afflictions are born, this is the method of the branches of existence.
Here, the cause is origination, the arisen is considered the effect,
the opponent of knowledge is another dharma, like untruth, the friend of ignorance.
Due to the word 'joining' and so on, if not due to wrong wisdom,
from the view of its conjunction, due to the teaching of afflictions of wisdom.

children.text: nāma tvarūpiṇaḥ skandhāḥ sparśāḥ ṣaṭ saṃnipātajāḥ /
children.translated_text: The aggregates, indeed, without form, are contacts born of six conjunctions,
five are contacts with obstruction, the sixth is called designation.
Contacts of knowledge and ignorance, remaining untainted and afflicted,
are the contacts of enmity and attachment, three are known as pleasant feelings and so on.

children.text: tajjāḥ ṣaḍvedanāḥ pañca kāyikī caitasī parā /
children.translated_text: Born of that, six sensations, five are physical, the supreme is mental,
again, they are of eighteen kinds, by mental consideration.
In desire, all are self-supporting, having form, with twelve domains,
the upper of the three, in two meditations, twelve are moving in desire.

children.text: svo 'ṣṭālambanam ārūpyo dvayoḥ dhyānadvaye tu ṣaṭ /
children.translated_text: Own, with eight supports, formless, in two meditations, there are six,

children.text: kāmāḥ ṣaṇṇāṃ caturṇā svaḥ ekasyālambanaṃ paraḥ // VAkK_3.34 //
children.translated_text: desires of six, four self-supports, one is the support of another.
Four are formless, at the boundary, moving in form, one is upward-moving,

children.text: eko maule svaviṣayaḥ sarve 'ṣṭādaśa sāsravāḥ // VAkK_3.35 //
children.translated_text: one is the root, own domain, all eighteen are with afflictions.

children.text: uktaṃ ca vakṣyate cānyat atra tu kleśā iṣyate /
children.translated_text: It is said and will be said otherwise, here indeed afflictions are desired,
like a seed, like a serpent, like a root, like a tree, like chaff.
Like husked rice, action, similarly like a herb, like a flower,
like prepared food and drink, is the entity in that fourfold existence.
Existence of rebirth is afflicted by all afflictions of its own realm,

children.text: tridhānye traya ārūpye āhārasthitikaṃ jagat // VAkK_3.38 //
children.translated_text: threefold in others, three are formless, the world is sustained by food.
The food is of the nature of morsel in desire, having three bases,
not the base of form, therefore, due to the release from one's own sense.
Contacts, intentions, consciousnesses are foods, with afflictions in three,
mind-made, seeking existence, is the <s>Gandharva</s> in intermediate existence.
And cessation here is for nourishment, of the two, the support and the supported.
For the purpose of removing the projection of duality in accordance with the sequence,
the causes of cutting, joining, dispassion, loss, fall, and occurrence,
are desired in mental knowledge; in equanimity, there are fall and emergence
These two, of non-concentration of mind, in the unmanifested duality,
the sequential fall in the feet, navel, and heart, is the fall of the mind
The cutting of vital points of demons, serpents, and elephants, through weapons and others,
is rightly determined as falsehood, causing an unbroken sequence of noble ones
There, below, they describe the arrangement of the vessel of the world,
the air sphere, sixteen lakh units high, countless in number
The water is eleven units high, with twenty thousand units
Eight lakh units high, then the rest becomes golden
Transversely, three thousand and a half, with four hundred
Twelve lakh units, and indeed, the water-golden sphere
All around, threefold, there is <s>Meru</s>, <s>Yugandhara</s>,
<s>Īśādhāra</s>, <s>Khadiraka</s>, and <s>Sudarśana</s> mountain as well
<s>Aśvakarṇa</s>, <s>Vinitaka</s>, then <s>Nimindhara</s> mountain,

children.text: dvīpāḥ bahiścakravāḍaḥ sapta haimāḥ sa āyasaḥ // VAkK_3.49 //
children.translated_text: Islands, the outer circle, seven golden and one iron
<s>Meru</s> is made of four gems, in water of eighty thousand units
Immersed above the water, <s>Meru</s> is again eighty thousand units
Half and half decrease in eight, of equal height and density
Seven cold ones in between them, the first is eighty thousand units

children.text: ābhyantaraḥ samudro 'sau triguṇaḥ sa tu pārśvataḥ /
children.translated_text: The internal ocean is threefold, that is sideways,

children.text: ardhārdhenāparāḥ śītāḥ śeṣaṃ bāhyo mahodadheḥ // VAkK_3.52 //
children.translated_text: Half and half are the other cold ones, the rest is the outer great ocean

children.text: lakṣatrayaṃ sahasrāṇi viṃśatirdve ca tatra tu /
children.translated_text: Three lakh units, twenty thousand and two there indeed
<s>Jambūdvīpa</s> is two thousand units with three sides, in the shape of a cart
One and a half yojanas, indeed, <s>Prāgvideha</s> is crescent-shaped

children.text: pārśvatrayaṃ tathāsya ekaṃ sārdhaṃ triśatayojanam // VAkK_3.54 //
children.translated_text: Three sides, thus, one and a half, three hundred yojanas
<s>Godānīya</s> is seven and a half thousand units, circular

children.text: sārdhe dve madhyamasya aṣṭau caturasraḥ kuruḥ samaḥ // VAkK_3.55 //
children.translated_text: Two and a half of the middle, eight square, <s>Kuru</s> is equal
The bodies are <s>Videha</s>, <s>Kuru</s>, <s>Kaurava</s>, and <s>Āmarāvarā</s>
Eight are the islands in between them, <s>Gāṭha</s>, and northern ministers
Here to the north, <s>Kīṭādri</s>, then nine from <s>Himavān</s>
Fifty wide and long, a lake south of <s>Gandhamādana</s>
Below, twenty thousand units, such is <s>Avīci</s> indeed

children.text: tadūrdhvaṃ sapta narakāḥ sarve 'ṣṭau ṣoḍaśotsadāḥ // VAkK_3.58 //
children.translated_text: Above that, seven hells, all eight sixteen units high
<s>Kukūla</s>, <s>Kuṇapa</s>, and then <s>Kṣuramārga</s>, the river
Their four directions are cold, others are eight, starting from <s>Arvuda</s>
Half of <s>Meru</s>, <s>Candra</s> and <s>Arka</s> are fifty and one yojanas
Midnight is setting, midday is rising once
In the second month of the rainy season, on the last ninth, the night increases

children.text: hemantānāṃ caturthe tu hīyate aharviparyayāt // VAkK_3.61 //
children.translated_text: In the fourth of the winter months, indeed, the day decreases by reversal
Gradually, the increase of night and day, as the sun moves south or north
Due to the proximity of the sun, the clear shadow is seen like the new moon
Four boundaries of this, with ten thousand in between

children.text: ṣoḍaśāṣṭau sahasrāṇi catvāri dve ca nirgatāḥ // VAkK_3.63 //
children.translated_text: Sixteen, eight thousand, four and two have emerged
In them, skull-bearers, garland-bearers, always givers of restraint
And the <s>Mahārājika</s> gods, also on the seven mountains
On the peak of <s>Meru</s>, the thirty-three, with eighty thousand directions
In the directions, four peaks inhabited by thunderbolt bearers
In the middle, one and a half thousand units, half a yojana

children.text: puraṃ sudarśanaṃ nāma haimaṃ citratalaṃ mṛdu // VAkK_3.66 //
children.translated_text: A city named <s>Sudarśana</s>, golden, with a soft, variegated surface
One and a half hundred units on the side, outside again <s>Vaijayanta</s>
Adorned with the roughness of <s>Caitraratha</s>, mixed with <s>Nandana</s>
Twenty intervening, their good lands in four directions
In the northeast, <s>Pārijāta</s>, <s>Sudharmā</s> in the southwestern

children.text: tata ūrdhva vimāneṣu devāḥ kāmabhujastu ṣaṭ /
children.translated_text: Then above, in the aerial chariots, are the six gods enjoying desires
Embracing in pairs, holding hands, with eyes filled with desire for union
As long as a child is comparable to five years, comparable to ten years,
In these, the complete ones are born, and indeed, those with forms are clothed.
There are three kinds of attainments of desire, the <s>Kāmadevas</s> are equal to humans,
There are three kinds of attainments of happiness, the nine-fold meditative states.
From place to place downwards, so upwards from there and there,
There is no upward vision for them except from the reliance on powers.
The four continents, the moon, the sun, <s>Meru</s>, and the celestial beings of desire,
And a thousand <s>Brahmalokas</s>, and a thousand is considered the top.
That thousand, the two-thousand is the middle world realm,
That thousand, the three-thousand is born in the simultaneous evolution.
The <s>Jambudvīpas</s> in measure are four and a half cubits,
With double increase, they are called east, south, and north.
With foot increase, slender as long as a half <s>krośa</s> of the celestial beings,

children.text: kāmināṃ rūpiṇāṃ tvādau yojanārdhaṃ tataḥ param // VAkK_3.76 //
children.translated_text: For the desirous and those with forms, at first half a <s>yojana</s>, then beyond.
Half-half increase upwards, the reliance from the diminutive,
Leaving the clouds, three <s>yojanas</s> with double-double.
A thousand years of life among the <s>Kurus</s>, except for half-half of two,

children.text: ihāniyatam ante tu daśābdāḥ ādito 'mitam // VAkK_3.78 //
children.translated_text: Here indefinite at the end, but ten years from the beginning infinite.
Fifty years of men, a day and night of the celestial beings,
In desire, for the lower, therefore life is five hundred years.
Double increase for the upper, both for those with forms again,
There is no day and night, life is measured by <s>kalpas</s> in their own reliance.
In the formless, twenty thousand <s>kalpas</s>, more and more,
The <s>Mahākalpa</s> from the diminutive, from the beginning to the end of <s>Dharma</s>.
Equal to the life of the <s>Kāmadevas</s>, day and night in order,
In the six beginning with <s>Saṃjīva</s>, their life is like that of the <s>Kāmadevas</s>.
Half in <s>Pratāpana</s>, in <s>Avīci</s>, the intermediate <s>kalpa</s> again,

children.text: kalpaṃ tiraścāṃ pretānāṃ māsānhā śatapañcakam // VAkK_3.83 //
children.translated_text: A <s>kalpa</s> for animals and ghosts, months, days, and five hundred.
From <s>Vāha</s>, with a hundred years, one grain, the exhaustion of life,
From <s>Arvuda</s>, twenty-fold increase, life of others.
Outside the <s>Kurus</s>, intermediate death, moments of atoms,
Up to the end of form and name, atom and subtle as well.
Iron, water, ox, hole, dust, sesame seed, their origin,
Barley, joint of a finger, known as seven-fold increase.
Twenty-four fingers make a cubit, four cubits,

children.text: dhanuḥ pañcaśatānyeṣāṃ krośo raṇyaṃ ca tanmatam // VAkK_3.87 //
children.translated_text: A bow is five hundred of these, a <s>krośa</s> is a measure of land, it is considered so.
They say eight is a <s>yojana</s>, twenty, a hundred moments again,

children.text: tatkṣaṇaḥ te punaḥ ṣaṣṭirlavaḥ triṃśad guṇottarāḥ // VAkK_3.88 //
children.translated_text: That moment, they again, sixty, a fraction, thirty-fold increase.
Three <s>muhūrttas</s> make a day and night, months, twelve months,

children.text: saṃvatsaraḥ sonarātraḥ kalpo bahuvidhaḥ smṛtaḥ // VAkK_3.89 //
children.translated_text: A year with day and night, a <s>kalpa</s> is remembered as manifold.
The <s>Saṃvartta Kalpa</s> from the origin of hell, destruction of the vessel,
The <s>Vivarta Kalpa</s> from the previous wind, until the origin of hell.
The intermediate <s>kalpa</s> from the infinite, until ten years of life, then,

children.text: utkarṣā apakarṣāśca kalpā aṣṭā daśāpare // VAkK_3.91 //
children.translated_text: There are eight <s>kalpas</s> of increase and decrease, and ten others.
One increase is up to eighty thousand years of life,

children.text: iti loko vivṛtto 'yaṃ kalpāṃstiṣṭhati viṃśatim // VAkK_3.92 //
children.translated_text: Thus, this world is open, it remains for twenty <s>kalpas</s>.
It evolves, then is enveloped, remains, it evolves evenly,
They are eighty, the <s>Mahākalpa</s>, that arises from three incalculables.
Buddhahood in decrease, indeed, up to a hundred, that arising,
Of two solitary Buddhas, the sword, lineage of a hundred <s>kalpas</s>.
The emergence of a <s>Cakravarti</s> is not below eighty thousand,
Golden, silver, copper, iron wheel-holders, they are in descending order.

children.text: ekadvitricaturdvīpāḥ na ca dvau saha buddhavat /
children.translated_text: One, two, three, four continents, not two together like the Buddha,
Confronting, self-moving, victorious in conflict, weapons, limits.
By the excellence of characteristics, full in location, heated,

children.text: prāgāsan rūpivat sattvāḥ rasarāgāttataḥ śanaiḥ // VAkK_3.97 //
children.translated_text: Previously, beings with form existed, from taste and desire, then gradually.
Having established proximity due to indolence, the lord of the field is supported by those with grudges,
therefore, due to the excess of the path of action, there is a reduction in the ten stages of life.
The end of the <s>kalpa</s> (aeon) occurs through weapons, diseases, and famine,

children.text: divasān sapta māsāṃśca varṣāṇi ca yathākramam // VAkK_3.99 //
children.translated_text: over a period of seven days, months, and years respectively.
Again, there are three destructions by fire, water, and wind,

children.text: dhyānatrayaṃ dvitīyādi śīrṣa tāsāṃ yathākramam // VAkK_3.100 //
children.translated_text: the three meditations following the second, are their heads in sequence.
Due to the similarity to the removal of that, there is no fourth due to lack of staining,

children.text: na nityaṃ saha sattvena tadvimānodayavyayāt // VAkK_3.101 //
children.translated_text: not always together with existence, due to the rise and fall of that vehicle.

children.text: saptāgninā adbhirekā evaṃ gate 'dbhiḥ saptake punaḥ /
children.translated_text: With seven fires, there is one with waters; thus, when it happens, with seven waters again,
with radiance sevenfold, then the destruction by wind follows.

body.text: abhidharmakośabhāṣye lokanirdeśo nāma tṛtīyaṃ kośasthānam samāptamiti /
body.translated_text: In the <s>Abhidharmakośabhāṣya</s>, the section called 'Description of the World' as the third section of the treasury is thus concluded.
Whatever merit there is here of <s>Śrī Lāmāvākasya</s>
The fourth section of the treasury

children.text: karmajaṃ lokavaicitryaṃ cetanā tatkṛtaṃ ca tat /
children.translated_text: The variety of the world is born of action, and consciousness is its cause,

children.text: cetanā mānasaṃ karma tajjaṃ vākkāyakarmaṇī // VAkK_4.1 //
children.translated_text: consciousness is mental action, and that which is born from it is verbal and bodily action.
They are considered as both manifest and unmanifest, with bodily manifestation,

children.text: saṃsthānaṃ na gatiryasmātsaṃskṛtaṃ kṣaṇikaṃ vyayāt // VAkK_4.2 //
children.translated_text: because it is formation, not movement, conditioned and momentary due to decay.

children.text: na kasyacidahetoḥ syāt hetuḥ syācca vināśakaḥ /
children.translated_text: It is not the cause of anything, yet it is a cause and a destroyer,

children.text: dvigrāhyaṃ syāt na cāṇau tat vāgvijñaptistu vāgdhvaniḥ // VAkK_4.3 //
children.translated_text: it is to be grasped in two ways, and it is not in the atom; verbal manifestation is the sound of speech.
The threefold increase of pure form is not done by the path, etc.,
above the moment, unmanifest is born from the past of desire.
Taking one's own elements, bodily and verbal action is with defilement,
where the unmanifest is born, without acquisition, is without defilement.
And the effusion called existence, born from the acquired elements,
are born from concentration, accumulative, non-acquired, different from the elements.
There is no unmanifest in the indeterminate, again in three ways the impure,
in desire and form, unmanifest is manifest with reflection.
In desire too, it is not ceased, there is no arising due to falsehood,
ultimate purity is liberation, from oneself, root, and lack of shame.
By conjunction, those connected arise, not the actions, etc.,
by the opposite, unwholesome in the ultimate indeterminate, constant.
Arising is twofold, known as cause and instantaneous arising,
the first is initiating, the second is following.
The initiating is to be abandoned by view, both consciousnesses again,
mental is to be abandoned by cultivation, the fivefold is following.
In the initiating, at the beginning of purity, it is threefold following,

children.text: tulyaṃ muneḥ śubhaṃ yāvat nobhayaṃ tu vipākajam // VAkK_4.12 //
children.translated_text: equally pure for the sage until both are resultant.
Unmanifest is to be known in three ways: restraint, non-restraint, and the other,
restraint is known as <s>prātimokṣa</s>, born of meditation, and without defilement.
The <s>prātimokṣa</s> is eightfold, but fourfold in substance,

children.text: liṅgato nāmasaṃcārāt pṛthak te cāvirodhinaḥ // VAkK_4.14 //
children.translated_text: by sign, by name, they are separate, and they do not contradict.
From the five, eight, ten, from all, by abstaining from the exceptions,
the lay follower, fasting, the ascetic, the student, the mendicant.
Ethical conduct, good behavior, action, restraint is also called,
in the first, manifest and unmanifest, the <s>prātimokṣa</s> action path.
Endowed with <s>prātimokṣa</s>, eightfold, connected with that born of meditation,
with the undefiled, noble beings, the last two follow the mind.
In the non-returner, known as abandonment, those two are born from the uninterrupted path,
two are concentration and mindfulness, restraint of mind and senses.
Established in <s>prātimokṣa</s>, always with non-abandonment, with the present,
endowed with unmanifest from the past, above the moment, with the past.
Similarly, the one in non-restraint too, always endowed with meditation restraint,
with the past-born, the noble one in the first, not with the past.
Those two, established in the concentrated noble path, are connected with the present,

children.text: madhyasthasyāsti cedādau madhyayā ūrdhvaṃ dvikālayā // VAkK_4.21 //
children.translated_text: for the neutral one, if at the beginning, with the middle, above with two times.
The one in non-restraint is established in restraint by the pure and impure.
avijñaptyānvito yāvat prasādakleśavegavān // VAkK_4.22 //

children.text: vijñaptyā tu punaḥ sarve kurvanto madhyayānvitāḥ /

children.translated_text: mithyādṛṣṭiḥ trayo hyatra panthānaḥ sapta karma ca // VAkK_4.78 //
The uprooting is by the false view of those who gain through the arising of desires,
by the denial of cause and effect, in all ways, sequentially among men
A woman or man, by their visible conduct, severs that non-concordance,
the union by the desire for sight, not here creating immediacy
Simultaneously, it exists with eight unwholesome ones,
the mind with ten wholesome ones, not with one, eight, or five
Divided are the idle talk, harshness, and malice in hell,
by association, covetousness, false view, in the Kurus three
The seventh here itself in desire, elsewhere ten unwholesome ones,
but three wholesome ones everywhere from the state of presence
In the formless, non-perceptive beings, by gain, seven remain,
and by the state of presence, abandoning the hellish Kurus
All are considered as giving fruits of ripening from the flow of the chief,
from suffering, killing, and loss of strength, the fruit is threefold
Born from greed, bodily and verbal actions, false livelihood, are made separate,

children.text: duḥśodhatvāt pariṣkāralobhotthaṃ cet na sūtrataḥ // VAkK_4.86 //
children.translated_text: due to difficulty of purification, arising from greed for adornment, indeed not from the <s>Sūtra</s>
prahāṇamārge samale saphalaṃ karma pañcabhiḥ /
