The fifth act among the acts with immediate consequence is the destruction of a <s>stūpa</s>
It creates extreme obstacles to the attainment of <s>Kṣānti</s>, <s>Anāgāmi</s> status, and <s>Arhatship</s>

children.text: bodhisattvaḥ kuto yāvat yato lakṣaṇa karmakṛt /
children.translated_text: From where is the <s>Bodhisattva</s> until where, from which characteristic does he perform actions
A well-born man, unconfused, with good birth, remembering past lives, not turning back
In the land of <s>Jambūdvīpa</s>, only a man directly faces the Buddha's consciousness

children.text: cintāmayaṃ kalpaśate śeṣa ākṣipate hi tat // VAkK_4.109 //
children.translated_text: Indeed, that one reflects for a hundred <s>kalpas</s> and then discards the remainder
Each one is born from a hundred merits, the last of three countless aeons
<s>Vipaśyī</s>, <s>Dīpakṛt</s>, <s>Ratnaśikhī</s>, and <s>Śākyamuni</s> in ancient times
Everywhere, giving everything out of compassion completes the act of giving
Even in the cutting of limbs, without anger, of those with attachment and patience
With the hymn of <s>Tiṣya</s>, following the courage and concentration

children.text: puṇyaṃ kriyātha tadvastu trayaṃ karmapathā yathā // VAkK_4.112 //
children.translated_text: The merit is then created, that object, the threefold path of action as it is
That which is given, with the desire for worship and favor

children.text: kāyavākkarma sotthānaṃ mahābhogyaphalaṃ ca tat // VAkK_4.113 //
children.translated_text: The actions of body and speech arise from it, and that is the great enjoyable fruit
It is given for one's own purpose, for others' purpose, for both purposes or for neither
Its distinction again is from the special nature of the giver, object, and field

children.text: dātā viśiṣṭaḥ śraddhādyaiḥ satkṛtyādi dadāti ataḥ /
children.translated_text: The giver is distinguished by faith and other qualities, hence gives with respect and more
Due to respect, noble disposition, and indestructibility over time
With excellence in complexion and others, the object is beautiful or famous
Affection, tenderness, seasonal comfort, and pleasant touch arise from that
The field is distinguished by qualities of aiding in the journey and suffering

children.text: agraṃ muktasya muktāya bodhisattvasya ca aṣṭamam // VAkK_4.117 //
children.translated_text: Foremost for the liberated, for the liberated one, and for the <s>Bodhisattva</s>, the eighth
To the mother, father, the sick, the one who speaks about <s>Dharma</s>, and to the lowest birth
And to the <s>Bodhisattva</s>, even to the non-Aryans, the gift is given
The back, the field, the foundation, the application, and the intention
Due to their mildness or intensity, the mildness or intensity of action
By completion of intention and action, through opposition and purification
Due to retinue and maturation, karma is said to be accumulated
In the <s>caitya</s>, the merit connected with renunciation is taken by loving-kindness and others
In a bad field, even desired fruit is obtained due to the non-reversal of seed and fruit
Misconduct is an impure form, and virtue is its abstention, in two ways

children.text: pratikṣiptācca buddhena viśuddhaṃ tu caturguṇam // VAkK_4.122 //
children.translated_text: Rejected by the <s>Buddha</s>, what is pure is indeed fourfold
Destroyed by the cause of misconduct, it rests in the opposite, in peace

children.text: samāhitaṃ tu kuśalaṃ bhāvanā cittavāsanāt // VAkK_4.123 //
children.translated_text: Concentration is a wholesome state due to cultivation and mental disposition
Virtue is for heaven due to prominence, cultivation is for separation

children.text: caturṇāṃ brāhmapuṇyatvaṃ kalpaṃ svargeṣu modanāt // VAkK_4.124 //
children.translated_text: The merit of the four Brahma realms is enjoyed in heaven for an aeon
The gift of <s>Dharma</s> is the undistorted teaching of <s>Sūtras</s> and others
The wholesome accompanies merit, nirvāṇa, and dispassion in three ways
Action initiated by <s>Yoga</s> is with threefold stimulation

children.text: lipimudre sagaṇanaṃ kāvyaṃ saṃkhyā yathākramam // VAkK_4.126 //
children.translated_text: Script, seal, counting, poetry, and enumeration in order

children.text: sāvadyā nivṛtā hīnāḥ kliṣṭāḥ dharmāḥ śubhāmalāḥ /
children.translated_text: The faulty are withdrawn, the lowly, the afflicted, the pure and impure <s>Dharma</s>s
The refined, the cultured, the auspicious are to be served, and liberation is unsurpassed

body.translated_text: In the <s>Abhidharma-kośa</s>, the explanation of karma is the fourth section

children.translated_text: The root of existence are the latent tendencies, sixfold desire, and aversion

children.text: māno 'vidyā ca dṛṣṭiśca vicikitsā ca te punaḥ // VAkK_5.1 //
children.translated_text: Pride, ignorance, views, and doubt, those are again
From the division of sixfold desire, seven are spoken, desire for existence in two realms
Due to inwardness, it is made for the withdrawal of the notion of liberation
Five views: the view of a real body, the view of extremes, the view of grasping
And the attachment to views, conduct, and vows, thus again ten
These ten, seven, seven, eight, without the three views
Are gradually abandoned through the vision of suffering and others in <s>Kāma</s>
Four are to be abandoned by cultivation, those are again without aversion
In the <s>Rūpadhātu</s> and likewise in the <s>Arūpya</s>, thus eighty-nine are considered
Born at the summit of existence, to be abandoned by patience and vision are the remaining
To be abandoned by vision and cultivation, by cultivation alone indeed
The views that are devoid of self, possession, permanence, and cessation,
are the views in the path without cause; these are the five views.
Due to the misconception of eternal self in <s>Īśvara</s> and others,
there arises the attachment to cause; thus, it is indeed the view of suffering to be abandoned.
From the three views arises the fourfold misconception, contrary to truth,

children.text: nitīraṇāt samāropāt saṃjñācitte tu tadvaśāt // VAkK_5.9 //
children.translated_text: from misapprehension, imposition, and due to the influence of perception in the mind.
Seven measures, ninefold from the three, are the cessation of false views and perceptions,
established in destruction and other aspects, to be abandoned by contemplation.
The desire for extinction does not occur for the noble one, nor do the afflictions,

children.text: nāsmitā dṛṣṭipuṣṭatvāt kaukṛtyaṃ nāpi cāśubham // VAkK_5.11 //
children.translated_text: nor does the notion of self, due to the nourishment of views, nor regret, nor anything inauspicious.
The views that are everywhere, the views of the cause of suffering to be abandoned,

children.text: vimatiḥ saha tābhiśca yāvidyāveṇikī ca yā // VAkK_5.12 //
children.translated_text: and the doubt along with them, which is associated with ignorance.
The nine upper supports of these are devoid of the twofold views,
those who are companions are also all-pervasive, except for attainment.
False views and doubt, associated with ignorance, are alone,
to be abandoned by the view of the path of cessation, the six are in the realm of the non-influences.
The path is the cessation of one's own ground, sixfold and ninefold,
the sphere of those in that realm; indeed, the path is mutually dependent.
There is no attachment due to its exclusion, no aversion due to non-harm,

children.text: na māno na parāmarśau śāntaśuddhyagrabhāvataḥ // VAkK_5.16 //
children.translated_text: no pride, no speculation, due to the supreme state of tranquility and purity.
The latent tendencies, all-pervasive, associate with all,
from the support of their own ground, confined to their own group, not all-pervasive.
The various non-influences are in the upper realm, due to non-acceptance and opposition,

children.text: yena yaḥ saṃprayuktastu sa tasmin saṃprayogataḥ // VAkK_5.18 //
children.translated_text: with which one is associated, he is thus in that association.
Above, all are undefined, in desire, the view of a real body,

children.text: antagrāhaḥ sahābhyāṃ ca mohaḥ śeṣāstvihāśubhāḥ // VAkK_5.19 //
children.translated_text: and the grasping of an end, along with these two, delusion, the rest here are inauspicious.
In desire, the roots of unwholesomeness are attachment, aversion, and delusion,
the three roots of unwholesomeness are craving, ignorance, and that cognition.
Due to the twofold upper tendency, there are no other two, only four, the external ones,
craving, false view, pride, and delusion, due to the triad of meditation and ignorance.
The explanation is in one aspect, divided and inquired into,
and to be established, like death, birth, the distinct self, and so forth.
With attachment, aversion, and pride, there may be those arisen from the past,
where they have arisen, not abandoned, they are associated with that object.
Everywhere, with these mental ones not gone, in one's own path and others,

children.text: ajaiḥ sarvatra śeṣaistu sarvaiḥ sarvatra saṃyutaḥ // VAkK_5.24 //
children.translated_text: with the unborn, everywhere, with the rest, with all, everywhere associated.
The existence in all times, due to being said, from the two, from the good object, from the result,
from the assertion of its existence, the assertions of all existence are desired, fourfold.
They are characterized by states of existence, designated as different and other,

children.text: tṛtīyaḥ śobhanaḥ adhvānaḥ kāritreṇa vyavasthitāḥ // VAkK_5.26 //
children.translated_text: the third is the excellent path, established by conduct.

children.text: kiṃ vighnaṃ tatkathaṃ nānyat adhvāyogaḥ tathā sataḥ /
children.translated_text: What is the obstacle, how is it not otherwise, the union with the path is thus of the existent,

children.text: ajātanaṣṭatā kena gambhīrā khalu dharmatā // VAkK_5.27 //
children.translated_text: by what is the unborn and destroyed, indeed profound is the nature of things.
When the view of suffering to be abandoned is relinquished, associated with all the rest,

children.text: prāk prahīṇe prakare ca śeṣaistadviṣayairmalaiḥ // VAkK_5.28 //
children.translated_text: before, when relinquished, in the expanse, with the rest, with the impurities of that realm.
The practices of the view of the cause of suffering, to be abandoned, born of the realm of desire,
attained in the same form of their own triad, in the realm of pure consciousness.
Of their own lower three, the upper one, the pure ones, born of the realm of form,
born of the formless, of the three realms, the triple, in the realm of the non-influences.
To be abandoned by the view of the path of cessation, all are in their own superior realm,
the non-influences are of the three realms, the final, in the realm of the non-influences.
Twofold, with latent tendencies, afflicted and untainted by the guides,
delusion, desire, then false view, from the view of a real body.
Then grasping an end, from that, reflection on conduct, then view,

children.text: rāgaḥ svadṛṣṭau mānaśca dveṣo 'nyatra ityanukramaḥ // VAkK_5.33 //
children.translated_text: attachment in one's own view, pride, and aversion elsewhere, thus the sequence.
From the non-abandoned latent tendency, from the object, from the arisen presence,
from improper attention, the affliction is the complete cause.
In desire, the afflictions with finality, without the outflow of desire,

children.text: mohena anuśayā eva rūpārūpye bhavāsravaḥ // VAkK_5.35 //
children.translated_text: Through delusion, indeed, the latent tendencies are the outflows of existence in the realm of form and formlessness
For they are inwardly directed and undifferentiated, being in the state of concentration
Thus, unified, they are the root ignorance, and the outflows are separate
Thus, the conjunction of streams of views results in differentiation due to clarity
There is no favorability towards those without outflows, indeed, no assistance
As mentioned, ignorance is of two kinds through the discernment of views

children.text: upādānāni avidyā tu grāhikā ne ti miśritā // VAkK_5.38 //
children.translated_text: Attachments are indeed ignorance, but not mixed with the grasping
These subtle ones follow and are of two kinds, also associated
Since they bind, therefore they are remembered as latent tendencies
They agitate, they flow, they take away, they also adhere
They also seize, thus are the definitions of those called outflows
Again, distinguished by bonds and others, they are said to be fivefold
Touching the substance, common view, is another bond
Due to extreme unwholesomeness, both are independent
Jealousy and envy are said to be separately two bonds
Fivefold in the lower realm, with two is the transgression of desire
With three, however, is the return, the root grasping of the face is threefold
The confusion of the path by desire for the unattained, the doubt of the path
Thus are the obstacles in the attainment of liberation, hence threefold is the instruction
Fivefold indeed in the higher realm, two desires in the form and formless realms
And arrogance, pride, and delusion are the three bonds due to ignorance
Even others, defiled mental factors, are designated as the aggregate of formations
From those afflictions, they are minor afflictions, yet not designated as afflictions
Shamelessness, lack of conscience, jealousy, envy, arrogance
Restlessness, sloth, torpor, thus eightfold is the establishment
Anger and malice arise from desire, shamelessness, arrogance, envy
Contention from delusion, sloth, torpor, lack of conscience
Restlessness from doubt, anger, jealousy, in the lineage of aversion

children.text: anye ca ṣaṭkleśamalāḥ māyā śāṭhyaṃ madastathā // VAkK_5.49 //
children.translated_text: And other six afflictive impurities, deceit, hypocrisy, pride as well
Spite, holding grudges, and violence arise from desire
Deceit and pride arise from aversion, grudges and violence
Spite arises from view and reflection, hypocrisy arises from view
There shamelessness, lack of conscience, sloth, torpor, and arrogance are twofold
Those others are to be abandoned through cultivation, and thus are independent impurities
In desire, three are impure, twofold by others, undifferentiated thereafter
Deceit and hypocrisy in the meditations from desire, due to deception of Brahma
Sloth, arrogance, pride in the three realms, others arise from the realm of desire
Equally established, to be abandoned through view, the mental consciousness base

children.text: upakleśāḥ svatantrāśca ṣaḍ vijñānāśrayāḥ pare // VAkK_5.54 //
children.translated_text: Minor afflictions are independent and the six are based on consciousness, others

children.text: sukhābhyāṃ saṃprayukto hi rāgaḥ dveṣo viparyayāt /
children.translated_text: Indeed, desire is associated with pleasure, aversion from the opposite
Delusion with all, false view with mental pain and pleasure
With displeasure, craving; others with pleasure arise from desire
All indeed with equanimity, each in their own way, in the higher realms
With displeasure, restlessness, jealousy, anger, violence

children.text: upanāhaḥ pradāśaśca mātsaryaṃ tu viparyayāt // VAkK_5.57 //
children.translated_text: Grudges, spite, and envy, indeed, from the opposite

children.text: māyā śāṭhyamatho mrakṣo middhaṃ cobhayathā madaḥ /
children.translated_text: Deceit, hypocrisy, and malice, torpor, and pride in both ways
With pleasures, universal equanimity, four others with five
In desire, hindrances, single opposition by action
With two signs, fivefold from the hindrance of aggregates and doubt
From the complete understanding of the support, from the destruction of that support
And from the abandonment of the support, from the arising of the opposite, is destruction
The nature of the basis of abandonment, known as defilement, is fourfold

children.text: pratipakṣaḥ prahātavyaḥ kleśa ālambanāt mataḥ // VAkK_5.61 //
children.translated_text: The opposite, to be abandoned, is considered an affliction due to the support
Due to distinctness, opposition, separation by place and time
As the distance of the twofold path of the elements, morality, and place
Once destruction, the attainment of non-connection, again and again for them
On the attainment of the fruits of the rise of the opposite, in the increase of the senses
There are nine recognitions due to the twofold exhaustion of forms such as desire

children.text: ekā dvayoḥ kṣaye dve te tathordhvaṃ tisra eva tāḥ // VAkK_5.64 //
children.translated_text: One in the exhaustion of two, two in the exhaustion of those, and then three indeed
Others in the lower division by the exhaustion of all defilements

children.text: tisraḥ parijñāḥ ṣaṭ kṣāntiphalaṃ jñānasya śeṣitāḥ // VAkK_5.65 //
children.translated_text: Three recognitions, six as the fruit of forbearance, the remainder of knowledge
The fruit of non-return for all meditations, or five alternatively
Eight for the <s>Sāmantaka</s>, one for the trio of <s>Maulā</s> gems

children.text: āryamārgasya sarvāḥ dve laukikasya anvayasya ca /
children.translated_text: All for the noble path, two for the worldly and its connection

children.text: dharmajñānasya tisrastu ṣaṭ tatpakṣasya pañca ca // VAkK_5.67 //
children.translated_text: Three for the knowledge of the <s>Dharma</s>, six for its side, and five
From the attainment of separation from the undefiled, of the supreme state of becoming
By the destruction of the twofold cause, recognition surpassing the elements
Not by one, with five, until the one established in vision is endowed

children.text: bhāvanāsthaḥ punaḥ ṣaḍibharekayā vā dvayena vā // VAkK_5.69 //
children.translated_text: Established in cultivation again, with six or with one or two
Of these, the collection from the attainment of the fruit of dispassion towards the elements

children.text: ekāṃ dve pañca ṣaṭ kaścijjahātyāpnoti pañca na // VAkK_5.70 //
children.translated_text: One, two, five, six, some abandon, some attain, five do not

body.translated_text: The section on recognition is concluded
In the <s>Abhidharma-kośa</s>, the exposition on latent tendencies, the fifth section is concluded
Whatever merit there is here of <s>Śrī Lāmāvākasya</s>
The sixth section of the treasury

children.translated_text: The abandonment of defilements is declared through the cultivation of the vision of truths
The path of cultivation is twofold, known as the vision and the undefiled
The truths are declared as four: suffering, origin, and so

children.text: nirodhamārga iti eṣāṃ yathābhisamayaṃ kramaḥ // VAkK_6.2 //
children.translated_text: Cessation and path, thus is the sequence according to realization
Sufferings are the threefold sufferings, according to the connection, completely

children.text: manāpā amanāpāśca tadanye caiva sāsravāḥ // VAkK_6.3 //
children.translated_text: Pleasant and unpleasant, and others indeed, defiled

children.text: yatra bhinnena tadbuddhiranyāpohe dhiyā ca tat /
children.translated_text: Where there is understanding by distinguishing, by the mind's exclusion of others
Like the meaning of a pot, conventional truth, ultimate truth otherwise
Established in conduct, possessing hearing and reflection, is applied in cultivation
The mind, having the name and the dual object as its domain, beginning with hearing
Of the twofold removal, of the unsatisfied and of the great desire
In the obtained, the satisfaction of desire again, in the not obtained, the great desire
From the perversion, those two opposites, pure and obtained in the threefold domain
Non-greed and noble lineage, these three are of the nature of satisfaction
By the end of action, the functioning with three, opposite to the arising of craving
My desire is for the cessation of that time of activity
There the entry with the impure and with mindfulness of breathing
Of those with thoughts of passion, the net for all passionate ones
From the expansion and contraction of bones like the ocean, the initial action
From the abandonment of the half of the skull, the victory is remembered
With the mind beyond, from the concentration of the mind in the middle of the eyebrows
Non-greed, ten grounds, with the visible object of desire, pure and impure
Mindfulness of breathing, wisdom, fivefold, moving with the air

children.text: kāmāśrayā na bāhyānām ṣaḍ vidhā gaṇanādibhiḥ // VAkK_6.12 //
children.translated_text: Based on desire, not external, sixfold by enumeration and others
Where breathing, the body, known as beings, is not grasped

children.text: naiḥṣyandikau nādhareṇa lakṣyete manasā ca tau // VAkK_6.13 //
children.translated_text: The flowing ones are not perceived below, and those by the mind
The one who has reached calmness should cultivate the establishment of mindfulness
From the examination of the two characteristics of body, feeling, mind, and phenomena
Wisdom consisting of hearing and others, others with the object of contact, in sequence
According to arising, the fourfold, indeed, opposite to perversion
He is established in the establishment of mindfulness on <s>Dharma</s>, with all objects
He perceives them as impermanent, suffering, empty, and non-self
Then the arising of the heat, that object of the four truths

children.text: ṣoḍaśākāram ūṣmabhyo mūrdhānaḥ te 'pi tādṛśāḥ // VAkK_6.17 //
children.translated_text: The sixteenfold from the heats, the heads, they are also like that
Both actions by <s>Dharma</s>, and indeed by others, growth

children.text: tebhyaḥ kṣāntiḥ dvidhā tadvat kṣāntyā dharmeṇa vardhanam // VAkK_6.18 //
children.translated_text: From them, forbearance, twofold, similarly, by forbearance, growth by <s>Dharma</s>
The object of suffering obtained by desire, and that moment is excessive

children.text: tathāgradharmāḥ sarve tu pañcaskandhāḥ vināptibhiḥ // VAkK_6.19 //
children.translated_text: Thus, the supreme <s>Dharma</s>s, all indeed, the five aggregates with attainments
Thus, the attainment of realization is fourfold and consists of cultivation,

children.text: anāgamyā ntaradhyānabhūmikam dve tvadho 'pi vā // VAkK_6.20 //
children.translated_text: and the two stages of meditation, the <s>Anāgāmin</s> and the intermediate state, below or above.
The woman attains the supreme virtues based on desire and those based on dual support,
the noble one relinquishes them by abandoning the ground, while the ignoble one by death.

children.text: ādye dve parihāṇyā ca maulestatraiva satyadṛk /
children.translated_text: In the first two, there is a decline; there, indeed, the one with true vision,
attains the unprecedented among the deficient, the two losses are without coordination.
The one who gains the summit is not uprooted, gaining tolerance without decay,

children.text: śiṣyagotrā nnivartya dve buddhaḥ syāt trīṇyapītaraḥ // VAkK_6.23 //
children.translated_text: having turned back from the disciple lineage, the Buddha becomes threefold, surpassing the fathers.
From the beginning of awakening, everything is together in the final meditation of the teacher's sword,
quick liberation is attained from the previous states in three existences.
The threefold actions consisting of hearing and reflection are impelled among people,
from worldly supreme virtues, there is the non-afflicted forbearance of the Dharma.
In the suffering of desire, hence here itself, there is the knowledge of Dharma again,
in the remaining suffering, in the knowledge of connected forbearance, and thus in the three truths.
Thus, this realization of the truths is threefold with sixteen minds,
it is known as the base of vision and object, it is the single ground of supreme Dharma.
The forbearance and knowledge are the immediate paths to liberation in due order,
the path of vision and non-vision, there are fifteen moments.
Among them, with gentle and keen faculties, following faith and Dharma,
not deficient in cultivation, to be abandoned, they are the ones who have attained the result.
As far as the destruction of the five kinds, in the second, below the exhaustion,
detached from desire, or above, are the third attained ones.

children.text: ṣoḍaśe tu phalasthau tau yatra yaḥ pratipannakaḥ /
children.translated_text: In the sixteenth, they are established in the result, where the one who has attained,
with faith, resolution, and vision, with gentle and keen faculties, then.
In the result, there is no gain of the path for the one distinguished by the result,
not applied for distinction, established in the result is the attained one.

children.text: navaprakārā doṣā hi bhūmau bhūmau tathā guṇāḥ /
children.translated_text: The ninefold faults indeed in each ground, and similarly the qualities,
of the gentle, middling, and superior, again differentiated by gentleness and so on.
The one not deficient in cultivation to be abandoned, established in the result, the seventh time is the supreme,
but the one liberated in three or four kinds is of the second or third birth, of noble lineage.
The one who destroys up to the fifth kind is the second attained one,
the one who has exhausted the sixth kind is again the one who returns once.
The one with the exhausted seventh and eighth portions of faults is the one with a single birth, a single wave,
and the third attained one, he is the <s>Anāgāmin</s> by the destruction of nine.
He is the one with the internally arisen formations, the unconditioned complete nirvana,
and the one who rises upwards in meditation, scattered, is the one who attains the highest.
He is the one who floats, half-floats, and falls away entirely, another is the one who reaches the summit of existence,
another is the one who attains the formless, fourfold, here is another extinguishing one.
Again, having made threefold, the nine who attain form are remembered,
their distinction again by the special nature of actions, afflictions, and faculties.
By the non-difference of the one who rises upwards, seven good destinies are considered,
by the existence and non-existence of functioning, and by the gone and returned.
The noble one who does not turn back from birth does not enter another realm in desire,
and he who ascends upwards does not partake in the movement of senses or decline.
The fourth is scattered before the completion, from the mixture of moments,
for the purpose of birth and dwelling, and also due to fear of afflictions.
From that fivefoldness, there are indeed five pure abodes of birth,
gaining cessation, the <s>Anāgāmin</s>, and the one who witnesses with the body is again considered.
The one who attains the summit of existence, having exhausted the eighth portion, is the one on the path to <s>Arhathood</s>,
and on the path of immediacy of the ninth, he is like a diamond.
By the attainment of that destruction, the knowledge of destruction, he is then the one who is learned, the <s>Arhat</s>,

children.text: lokottareṇa vairāgyaṃ bhavāgrāt anyato dvidhā // VAkK_6.45 //
children.translated_text: by the transcendental dispassion, from the summit of existence, or from elsewhere, in two ways.
By worldly noble dispassion, there are two attainments of disconnection,
and by the transcendental, as some say, having abandoned the connection with afflictions.
The one liberated from the summit of existence is associated with the state of higher birth,
by the non-afflicted dispassion of the <s>Anāgāmin</s> from all directions.
From meditation, the final liberation path arises in the threefold realm,
not above from <s>Sāmantaka</s> by the noble ones with eight upward arms.
Paths leading to immediate liberation are worldly in sequence,
beginning with peace and noble forms, traversing higher and lower realms.
If there is no unwavering knowledge from the wisdom of cessation,

children.text: kṣayajñānamaśaikṣo vā dṛṣṭiḥ sarvasya sārhataḥ // VAkK_6.50 //
children.translated_text: the insight of all, whether learned or unlearned, is from the wisdom of cessation.
The path of the ascetic is pure, its fruit is both cultivated and uncultivated,
ninety-one are those liberation paths along with cessations.
The establishment of four fruits arises from five causes,
abandonment of the previous, attainment of another path, accumulation of cessation as the fruit.
The attainment of the eightfold knowledge and the cultivation of the sixteen forms,

children.text: laukikāptaṃ tu miśratvānāsravāptiḥ dhṛteḥ phalam // VAkK_6.53 //
children.translated_text: obtained worldly due to mixture, the attainment of non-affliction is the fruit of firmness.
Brahmanhood and the wheel of Brahma arise from following the path of Brahma,
the wheel of Dharma is the path of vision, from dwelling in various places.

children.text: kāme trayāptiḥ antyasya triṣu nordhva hi dṛkpathaḥ /
children.translated_text: In desire, the attainment of three; for the final one, there is no upward vision path,

children.text: asaṃvegādiha vidhā tatra niṣṭheti cāgamāt // VAkK_6.55 //
children.translated_text: here is the establishment of non-disturbance, there is the conclusion according to the tradition.
Six are considered worthy, five of them born from faith and resolution,
liberation in their equanimity, of the unshakable and shakable Dharma.
Therefore, he is called not in time, he is related to the attainment of vision,
some of that lineage are from the beginning, some have come from elevation.
Of the four and five lineages, the loss of fruit is not from the former,

children.text: śaikṣānāryāśca ṣaḍgotrāḥ saṃcāro nāsti darśane // VAkK_6.58 //
children.translated_text: the six lineages of learned noble ones have no movement in vision.
Decline is to be known in three ways, from attainment, non-attainment, and enjoyment,

children.text: antyā śāsturakopyasya madhyā cānyasya tu tridhā // VAkK_6.59 //
children.translated_text: the final of the teacher is unshakable, the middle of another is threefold.

children.text: mriyate na phalabhraṣṭaḥ tadakārya karoti na /
children.translated_text: He does not die nor fall from fruit, he does not perform that which is unworthy,
paths of immediate liberation are in the nine unshakable by excessive practice.
In the attainment of vision, each one is without afflictions, growth among men,

children.text: aśaikṣo nava niśritya bhūmīḥ śaikṣastu ṣaṭ yataḥ // VAkK_6.61 //
children.translated_text: the unlearned rely on nine grounds, the learned have six because of that.
Abandoning the specific fruit, he attains fruit by increasing,

children.text: dvau buddhau śrāvakāḥ sapta navaite navadhendriyāḥ // VAkK_6.62 //
children.translated_text: two in the Buddha, seven in the hearers, these nine have nine senses.
Accomplished in both practices, concentration, and liberation,

children.text: pudgalāḥ sapta ṣaṭ tvete dvau dvau mārgatraye yataḥ // VAkK_6.63 //
children.translated_text: seven and six persons, these two in each of the three paths.
Liberated in both cessation and attainment, distinguished by wisdom,
complete with the fruits of concentration and senses, he is called learned.
The completeness of the unlearned is by two, the path is summarized,
called special liberation, immediate, and practice, fourfold.
In meditations, the path is of happiness and suffering in various grounds,
blessed knowledge for the gentle-minded, quick knowledge for the others.
Enlightenment is in the knowledge of non-arising and cessation, in accordance with that,

children.text: saptatriṃśattu tatpakṣyāḥ nāmato dravyato daśa // VAkK_6.67 //
children.translated_text: thirty-seven are those sides, by name and ten by substance.

children.text: śraddhā vīryaṃ smṛtiḥ prajñā samādhiḥ prītyupekṣaṇe /
children.translated_text: Faith, energy, mindfulness, wisdom, concentration, joy, and equanimity,
calmness, moral conduct, intentions, wisdom indeed is the presence of mindfulness.
Energy is called right effort, the bases of success are concentrations,

children.text: pradhānagrahaṇaṃ sarve guṇāḥ prāyogikāstu te // VAkK_6.69 //
children.translated_text: all qualities are for practical application, grasping the principal.
Influenced in the initial effort and the part of disillusionment,

children.text: bhāvane darśane caiva sapta vargā yathākramam // VAkK_6.70 //
children.translated_text: in cultivation and vision, indeed, seven groups in sequence.
The limbs of enlightenment and path are without afflictions, twofold in others,

children.text: sakalāḥ prathame dhyāne anāgamye prītivarjitāḥ // VAkK_6.71 //
children.translated_text: all in the first meditation, in the non-returner, devoid of joy.
In the second, except from intention, both are devoid of those two,

children.text: dhyānāntare ca śīlāṅgaistābhyāṃ ca triṣvarūpiṣu // VAkK_6.72 //
children.translated_text: in another meditation, with moral limbs, with those two and in three forms.
In the realm of desire and at the peak of existence, devoid of the limbs of the path of enlightenment,
in the vision of the three truths, moral conduct and Dharma, attaining non-disturbance.
The attainment in the convergence of the path, also in the Buddha and his community,
the Dharma is the threefold truth in the <s>Bodhisattva</s> and <s>Pratyekabuddhas</s>.

children.text: mārgaśca dravyatastu dve śraddhā śīlaṃ ca nirmalāḥ /
children.translated_text: mārgaśca dravyatastu dve śraddhā śīlaṃ ca nirmalāḥ /

children.text: noktā vimuktiḥ śaikṣāṅgaṃ baddhatvāt sā punardvidhā // VAkK_6.75 //
children.translated_text: Liberation not mentioned is a part of training due to bondage; it is again twofold
Unconditioned is the removal of afflictions, while conditioned is with intention

children.text: sāṅgaḥ saiva vimuktī dve jñānaṃ bodhiryathoditā // VAkK_6.76 //
children.translated_text: With parts, the same liberation is twofold knowledge, enlightenment as stated
The mind being born releases from the covering of training
The path being restrained abandons that covering
Unconditioned indeed is called element, dispassion is the destruction of passion
The element of abandonment for others, is called cessation of the substance
One becomes dispassionate through knowledge of patience with the cause of suffering
By all, one abandons, thus arises the fourfold

body.text: abhidharmakośe mārgapudgalanirdeśo nāma ṣaṣṭhaṃ kośasthānaṃ samāptamiti //
body.translated_text: In the <s>Abhidharma-kośa</s>, the section on the path and the individual is the sixth section's end

children.translated_text: Without impurity are patience and knowledge, the understanding of cessation and non-arising is not

children.text: tadanyobhayathāryā dhīḥ anyā jñānaṃ dṛśaśca ṣaṭ // VAkK_7.1 //
children.translated_text: That other, in both ways noble, is wisdom, other knowledge and views are six
The knowledge with and without defilements, the first is conventional knowledge
Undisturbed is twofold: knowledge of <s>Dharma</s> and also subsequent knowledge
Conventional is all objects, related to desire, suffering, and the like
Called <s>Dharma</s>, subsequent knowledge is related to higher suffering and the like

children.text: te eva satyabhedena catvāri ete caturvidhe /
children.translated_text: Those indeed by truth's distinction are four, these are fourfold
In knowledge of non-arising and cessation, they again are first mentioned
In knowledge of suffering's cause and subsequent, from four, the knower of other's minds

children.text: bhūmyakṣapudgalotkrāntaṃ naṣṭājātaṃ na vetti tat // VAkK_7.5 //
children.translated_text: He does not know that which is transcended to the realm, the lost and the unborn
That <s>Dharma</s> and subsequent knowledge are mutually dependent in the moment of view
The <s>Śrāvaka</s> knows three, the <s>Pratyekabuddha</s> all, the <s>Buddha</s> without application
Knowledge of cessation indeed in truths is the ascertainment of the known
Not to be known is the beginning, the thought of non-arising is considered
By nature and counter-opposition, from the realm of form and formlessness
Through application and accumulation, the cause of completion is ten
In the cessation of <s>Dharma</s> knowledge, or on the path of cultivation
Let the counter-opposition to the three realms be that, not subsequent to the realm of desire
Knowledge of <s>Dharma</s> and subsequent knowledge in sixteen modes otherwise

children.text: tathā ca sāṃvṛtaṃ svaiḥ svaiḥ satyākāraiścatuṣṭayam // VAkK_7.10 //
children.translated_text: Thus also conventional is by its own truth forms, the fourfold
Thus the supreme mental knowledge, pure and again impure
The form of the intrinsic characteristics of the knowable, pertaining to each individual substance
In the remaining fourteen modes, devoid of emptiness and non-self

children.text: nāmalaḥ ṣoḍaśabhyo 'nya ākāraḥ anye 'sti śāstrataḥ // VAkK_7.12 //
children.translated_text: Without impurity, other than the sixteen modes, others exist according to scripture
In substance, sixteen modes, the form of wisdom along with it

children.text: ākārayanti sālambāḥ sarvamākāryate tu sat // VAkK_7.13 //
children.translated_text: They form with support, everything is formed indeed
The first of the three realms, the skillful and others, the first in all realms

children.text: dharmākhyaṃ ṣaṭsu navasu tvanvayākhyaṃ tathaiva ṣaṭ // VAkK_7.14 //
children.translated_text: Called <s>Dharma</s> in six, in nine, and also called subsequent in six
In <s>Dhyāna</s>, other mental knowledge, and that which is based on form and desire
Based on desire, called <s>Dharma</s>, other based on the three realms
One mindfulness establishment, wisdom in cessation, knowledge of other minds

children.text: trīṇi catvāri śeṣāṇi dharmadhīgocaro nava // VAkK_7.16 //
children.translated_text: Three, four remaining, the field of wisdom of <s>Dharma</s> is nine
Nine paths, of subsequent knowledge, two for the knowledge of the cause of suffering

children.text: caturṇāṃ daśa naikasya yojyā dharmāḥ punardaśa // VAkK_7.17 //
children.translated_text: Of four, ten, not one, to be joined, <s>Dharma</s> again ten
<s>Dharma</s> of the three realms, impure and unconditioned, in two ways
Conventional, of one's own group, another, known from non-self
Accompanied by single knowledge, the passionate, in the first undisturbed moment
In the second with three, above, in four, increasing one by one
As they arise, patience and knowledge are cultivated in view
The future ones, there indeed, conventional and in the three subsequent
Therefore, called the final realization, that of non-arising <s>Dharma</s>
In cessation of one's own lower realm, the final, one's own truth form, effortful

children.text: ṣoḍaśe ṣaṭ sarāgasya vītarāgasya sapta tu /
children.translated_text: In the sixteenth, six for the passionate, seven for the dispassionate
Cultivation of passion on the path, beyond that, seven cultivations
In the path of <s>Ānantarya</s> above, even in the eightfold path of liberation;
In the liberation of training and elevation, there is the cultivation of six or seven knowledges;
In the path of <s>Ānantarya</s>, of the six, also in the conquest of the summit of existence;

children.text: navānāṃ tu kṣayajñāne akopyasya daśa bhāvanā /
children.translated_text: In the ninefold, in the knowledge of destruction, of the unshakable, there are ten cultivations;
In that progression and in the final liberation, in the remaining, eight cultivations are declared;
For dispassion, whatever is attained, there and below, it is cultivated;

children.text: sāsravāśca kṣayajñāne labdhapūrvaṃ na bhāvyate // VAkK_7.26 //
children.translated_text: And in the knowledge of destruction, that which is previously obtained is not cultivated;
In the cultivation known as acquisition and practice, which is well-prepared;
But in the cultivation of removing the opposition, of the defiled;
The eighteen unique <s>Buddha</s> qualities, such as strengths;

children.text: sthānāsthāne daśa jñānāni aṣṭau karmaphale nava // VAkK_7.28 //
children.translated_text: Ten knowledges in place and non-place, eight in the result of actions, nine;
In meditation, mastery, liberation, and in the element, in the practices;

children.text: daśa vā saṃvṛtijñānaṃ dvayoḥ ṣaṭ daśa vā kṣaye // VAkK_7.29 //
children.translated_text: Ten or the knowledge of concealment, six in two, or ten in destruction;
In the strength, meditation of the arising and cessation of beings, remaining;
In all realms, by what is his strength unobstructed;
The strength of <s>Nārāyaṇa</s> in the body, in the joints, others are tenfold;
The sevenfold strength of elephants and others, and that which is to be touched;
The confidence is fourfold, as in the first, in the tenth strength;
And in the second and seventh, the triad consisting of memory and wisdom;
Great compassion, the knowledge of concealment, with the range of accumulation and form;
Due to equality and intensity, the various actions are eightfold;
By the accumulation and the body of <s>Dharma</s>, and the activity for the world's benefit;
The equality of all <s>Buddhas</s> is not by age or birth measure;
Some other <s>Dharma</s> are common to disciples, by certain ordinary persons;
Qualities such as knowledge of aspiration and understanding of non-destruction;
The knowledge of concealment in meditation, in the final, of the unshakable <s>Dharma</s>;
Men who have not arisen, who have attained desire, and the range of afflictions;

children.text: tathaiva praṇidhijñānaṃ sarvālambaṃ tu tat tathā /
children.translated_text: Similarly, the knowledge of aspiration, having all support, is thus;

children.text: dharmārthayorniruktau ca pratibhāne ca saṃvidaḥ // VAkK_7.37 //
children.translated_text: In the explanation of <s>Dharma</s> and meaning, and in the understanding of expression;
Three names, or the knowledge of speech, unchanging, in sequence;
The fourth, joined with liberation, of the path of speech mastery;
That one, dependent on the path of speech, nine knowledges in all realms;

children.text: daśa ṣaḍvārthasaṃvit sā sarvatra anye tu sāṃvṛtam // VAkK_7.39 //
children.translated_text: Ten or sixfold understanding of meaning, that one everywhere, others concealed;
In the <s>Dharma</s> of desire meditations, the understanding in speech, of the first desires;
Not attained by the variations, these six are at the extreme point;
Those sixfold are in accordance with all realms;
Attained at the peak of growth, those are from the application of other <s>Buddhas</s>;
In the attainment of hearing, mind, previous birth, cessation, arising, and destruction;

children.text: jñāta sākṣīkriyābhijñā ṣaḍ vidhā muktimārgadhīḥ // VAkK_7.42 //
children.translated_text: Known, witnessed, direct knowledge, sixfold, the wisdom of the path of liberation;
Fourfold knowledge of concealment in the mind, the fivefold knowledge;

children.text: kṣayābhijñā balaṃ yadvat pañca dhyānacatuṣṭaye // VAkK_7.43 //
children.translated_text: The strength as in the five, in the fourfold meditation;
Attainable in the domain of one's own lower realm, suitable from dispassion;
The third, threefold presence, the first in hearing, the attainment in vision;
In the undefined, hearing and vision direct knowledge, others are auspicious;

children.text: tisro vidyāḥ avidyāyāḥ pūrvāntādau nivarttanāt // VAkK_7.45 //
children.translated_text: Three knowledges, from the cessation of ignorance, from the beginning to the end;
In the final non-training, two named from that continuity arising;

children.text: iṣṭe śaikṣasya nokte tu vidye sāvidyasaṃtateḥ // VAkK_7.46 //
children.translated_text: In the desired training, not spoken, the knowledge of the continuity of ignorance;

children.text: ādyā tṛtīyā ṣaṣṭhī ca prātihāryāṇi śāsanam /
children.translated_text: The first, third, and sixth, the miracles, the teachings;
Unmoving due to non-deviation, from the application of the desired beneficial fruit;

children.text: ṛddhiḥ samādhiḥ gamanaṃ nirmāṇaṃ ca gatistridhā /
children.translated_text: Attainment, concentration, movement, and creation, the threefold path;
The teacher's mind-speed, the conveyance of others, and liberation;
Attained by desire, created, external, the fourfold sphere, twofold;

children.text: rūpāptaṃ dve tu nirmāṇacittaistāni caturdaśa // VAkK_7.49 //
children.translated_text: Attained by form, two by created minds, those fourteen;

children.text: yathākramaṃ dhyānaphalaṃ dve yāvat pañca nordhvajam /
children.translated_text: In sequence, two meditation fruits, up to five, not above;

children.text: tallābho dhyānavat śuddhāttatsvataśca tato 'pi te // VAkK_7.50 //
children.translated_text: That attainment, like meditation, pure from itself, and from that, they;
Creation in one's own realm, and speech with the lower.
The mere absence of form establishes a different state of being,
Even for the dead, there exists a foundation; not for the unstable, others say,
One is grasped by many, in the case of victory, however, the reverse occurs,
The unmanifested, produced through contemplation, is of three kinds, arising from attainment,

children.text: ṛddhirmantrauṣadhābhyāṃ ca karmajā ceti pañcadhā // VAkK_7.53 //
children.translated_text: And growth through <s>mantra</s> and herbs, and that which is born of action, thus fivefold,
With divine hearing and sight, and clarity of form, as the foundation of meditation,
Always in equal measure, in the realm of the distant and subtle,
The fleshly eye does not see that which is distant, covered, or subtle,
Therefore, the divine sight is perceived,
Those with sight numbering in the thousands, the <s>Arhat</s>, the sword, the instructors,
Other things too, attained through birth, are seen, not intermediate existence,

children.text: cetojñānaṃ tu tattredhā tarkavidyākṛtaṃ ca yat /
children.translated_text: The knowledge of the mind is there, produced by reasoning and learning,

children.text: jānate nārakā ādau nṛṇāṃ notpattilabhikam // VAkK_7.56 //
children.translated_text: In the beginning, the inhabitants of hell know, but not the humans, the arising of knowledge,

body.translated_text: In the <s>Abhidharma-kośa</s>, the section on knowledge is the seventh chapter,

children.translated_text: Meditations are said to be twofold, four in number, and their attainments,
<s>Samāpatti</s> is auspicious, with one-pointedness, accompanied by the five <s>skandhas</s>,
Like reflection, joy, and happiness, devoid of preceding and preceding elements,
Thus the formless, with four <s>skandhas</s>, arising from discernment in the lower realms,
Known as the perception of vast forms, along with three companions,
In the formless, there is the existence of form, the arising of form is from the mind,
Known as the infinity of space, the infinity of consciousness, nothingness,
Thus through application, but due to dullness, there is neither perception nor non-perception,
Thus the original <s>samāpatti</s> substance is eightfold, threefold,
Seven are tasted, pure, without defilement, the eighth is twofold,
Associated with taste, with craving, worldly, auspicious,
Pure, tasting that, transcending the world, without defilement,
In the first five, reasoning and reflection, joy, happiness, concentration,
Joy and others, clarity too, in the second, the fourfold limbs,

children.text: tṛtīye pañca tūpekṣā smṛtiḥ prajñā sukhaṃ sthitiḥ /
children.translated_text: In the third, five: equanimity, mindfulness, wisdom, happiness, stability,
At the end, four: neither happiness nor suffering, equanimity, mindfulness, concentration,

children.text: dravyato daśa caikaṃ ca prasrabdhi sukhamādyayoḥ /
children.translated_text: By substance, ten and one, tranquility, happiness in the first,

children.text: śraddhā prasādaḥ prītistu saumanasyaṃ dvidhāgamāt // VAkK_8.9 //
children.translated_text: Faith, clarity, joy, and contentment, through a twofold approach,
In the afflicted, true joy, happiness, clarity, discernment, mindfulness,
Equanimity, mindfulness, purity, some say, in tranquility and equanimity,
Due to the release from the eightfold washing, the fourth is unmoving,

children.text: vitarkacārau śvāsau ca sukhādi ca catuṣṭayam // VAkK_8.11 //
children.translated_text: Reasoning, reflection, breathing, and happiness, among other things, fourfold,
Contentment, happiness, equanimity, equanimity, and mental contentment,
Happiness and equanimity, equanimity, known in meditative attainments,
The knowledge of body, eye, and ear, that which raises awareness,

children.text: dvitīyādau tadādyāptaṃ akliṣṭāvyākṛtaṃ ca tat // VAkK_8.13 //
children.translated_text: In the beginning of the second, it is attained, untroubled, unmanifested,
He who possesses that, attains purity, through dispassion and attainment,

children.text: anāsravaṃ tu vairāgyāt kliṣṭaṃ hānyupapattitaḥ // VAkK_8.14 //
children.translated_text: Without defilement, through dispassion, afflicted, through the attainment of loss,
From the third upwards and downwards, the undefiled follows, auspicious,

children.text: utpadyate tathā śuddhāt kliṭaṃ cāpi svabhūmikam // VAkK_8.15 //
children.translated_text: Arising thus from the pure, the afflicted too, in its own realm,

children.text: kliṣṭāt svaṃ śuddakaṃ kliṣṭaṃ evaṃ cādharaśuddhakam /
children.translated_text: From the afflicted, one's own pure, afflicted, thus the lower pure,

children.text: cyutau tu śuddhakāt kliṣṭaṃ sarvaṃ kliṣṭāttu nottaram // VAkK_8.16 //
children.translated_text: In the fall, from the pure, the afflicted, all from the afflicted, not the superior,
The pure is fourfold, in order, as the portion of loss,
The arising of afflictions, its own realm, upwards, in accordance with the undefiled,

children.text: dve trīṇi trīṇi caikaṃ ca hāna bhāgādyanantaram /
children.translated_text: Two, three, three, and one, following the portion of loss,

children.text: gatvāgamya dvidhā bhūmīraṣṭau śliṣṭai kalaṅghitāḥ // VAkK_8.18 //
children.translated_text: Having gone and returned, the twofold realms are eight, with defects and without,
<s>Samāpatti</s> that transcends, going to the third of different kinds,
Based in one's own lower realm, the meditations are formless, the lower is futile,
From the forefront of the noble nothingness, indeed, the destruction of defilements,

children.text: satṛṣṇāḥ svabhavālambāḥ dhyānaṃ sadviṣayaṃ śubham // VAkK_8.20 //
children.translated_text: With craving, based on one's own existence, meditation is auspicious and with good objects,
The original skillful formless ones are not with defilement, in the range of the lower.

children.text: anāsraveṇa hīyante kleśāḥ sāmantakena ca // VAkK_8.21 //
children.translated_text: By the non-leaking, the afflictions are diminished, and by the <s>sāmantaka</s> too,
there are eight <s>sāmantakas</s> of these, pure, without pain and pleasure indeed,

children.text: ārya cādyaṃ tridhā kecit atarka dhyānamantaram // VAkK_8.22 //
children.translated_text: and the first noble one, some say, is threefold, the <s>dhyāna</s> without reasoning in between
threefold is that free from pain and pleasure, and it is the fruit of the great <s>Brahma</s>
with reasoning and reflection, the lower <s>samādhi</s>, beyond is non-dual
characterized by the absence of marks, from the emptiness of selflessness,
it proceeds unconditioned, with the true forms beyond that,
they are pure, spotless, and the three gateways to liberation,
the three further <s>samādhis</s> known as emptiness, non-emptiness, and others
two rely on the non-learner, from emptiness and also impermanence
and the markless is from the markless, from peace, innumerable destruction
among people with outflows, apart from the seven <s>sāmantakas</s> of the unshakeable

children.text: samādhibhāvanā dhyānaṃ subhamādyaṃ sukhāya hi // VAkK_8.27 //
children.translated_text: the cultivation of <s>samādhi</s>, the first auspicious <s>dhyāna</s>, indeed for happiness
desired for the vision, to the seers, for the destruction of intelligence, arising from practice
like a diamond in the last <s>dhyāna</s>, is the cultivation for the destruction of outflows
the four immeasurables, from the opposition of ill-will and others

children.text: maitryadveṣaḥ api karuṇā muditā sumanaskatā // VAkK_8.29 //
children.translated_text: friendliness, non-hatred, compassion, joy, and good will
equanimity, greed, form, being happy, being sad, indeed
rejoice, thus from beings, and the realm of beings of desire

children.text: dhyānayormuditā anyāni ṣaṭ su kecittu pañcasu /
children.translated_text: in the <s>dhyānas</s> the joy, and the others, six, but some say five

children.text: na taiḥ prahāṇaṃ nṛṣveva janyante tryanvito dhruvam // VAkK_8.31 //
children.translated_text: by them, the abandonment is not, among men indeed, they are produced, threefold, certainly
eight liberations, the first two unlovely, in the two <s>dhyānas</s>

children.text: tṛtīyo 'ntye sa cālobhaḥ śubhārūpyāḥ samāhitāḥ // VAkK_8.32 //
children.translated_text: the third is in the last, and that is non-greed, concentrated in the beautiful forms
cessation is the attainment, immediately after the subtle and subtle
by the noble pure one, the rising up of the mind thereafter
the first, those who are in the realm of the visible objects of desire
they are in the realm of the knowledge of connection, upward, of the nature of suffering, and others
the eight bases of mastery, like the two first liberations

children.text: dve dvitīyavat anyāni punaḥ śubhavimokṣavat // VAkK_8.35 //
children.translated_text: two like the second, and others again like the beautiful liberation

children.text: daśa kṛtsnāni alobhāṣṭau dhyāne 'ntye gocaraḥ punaḥ /
children.translated_text: the ten totalities, the eight non-greed, in the last <s>dhyāna</s> again the realm
the two desires, pure in form, in their own four aggregates' realm
cessation is said to be attained by the application of dispassion, the rest
the remainder is based on the three realms, the formless perception, and born of humans
from the cause and effect, the power of the two realms, the production of the formless

children.text: dhyānānāṃ rūpadhātau tu tābhyāṃ dharmatayāpi ca // VAkK_8.38 //
children.translated_text: of the <s>dhyānas</s> in the realm of form, indeed, by those two and by their nature
the true <s>Dharma</s> is twofold, of the teacher, consisting of scripture and realization

children.text: dhātārastasya vaktāraḥ pratipattāra eva ca // VAkK_8.39 //
children.translated_text: the bearers of it, the speakers and indeed the practitioners
this <s>Abhidharma</s> is mostly explained by me as established by the <s>Kāśmīra Vaibhāṣika</s> doctrine

children.text: yaddurguhītaṃ tadihāsmadāgaḥ saddharmanītau munayaḥ pramāṇam // VAkK_8.40 //
children.translated_text: whatever is difficult to grasp, that is here our tradition, the sages are the authority in the true <s>Dharma</s> doctrine

children.text: nimīlite śāstari lokacakṣuṣi kṣayaṃ gate sākṣijane ca bhūyasā /
children.translated_text: when the teacher, the eye of the world, is closed, when the witnesses are mostly gone
this teaching is made confused by the false reasoners, not seeing the truth, without restraint

children.text: gate 'tha śāntiṃ paramāṃ svayaṃbhuvi svayaṃbhuvaḥ śāsanadhūrdhareṣu ca /
children.translated_text: when the self-born one has gone to the supreme peace, and in the bearers of the teaching

children.text: jagatyanāthe gaṇaghātibhirmataiḥ niraṅkuśaiḥ svairamihādya caryate // VAkK_8.42 //
children.translated_text: when the world is orphaned, by the views of the destroyers of groups, unchecked, freely here today it is conducted
thus knowing the teaching of the sage is at the point of death

children.text: balakālaṃ malānāṃ ca na pramādyaṃ mumukṣubhiḥ // VAkK_8.43 //
children.translated_text: the time of strength and impurities should not be neglected by those desiring liberation

body.translated_text: In the <s>Abhidharmakośa</s>, the section on attainment is called the eighth place of the <s>Kośa</s>
